Summary: Email One-Time Code for Password Reset
Description: Implement a feature allowing users to reset their password using an email one-time code that expires in 10 minutes.
AcceptanceCriteria:
User receives a one-time code via email for password reset.
One-time code expires after 10 minutes.
User can reset password using a valid one-time code.

Description: Develop positive and negative test cases for OTP verification during password reset.
AcceptanceCriteria:
Test case for successful OTP verification.
Test case for expired OTP scenario.
Test case for invalid OTP scenario.

Summary: Rate Limiting for Password Reset Attempts
Description: Implement rate limiting to restrict password reset attempts to a maximum of 3 per hour per user.
AcceptanceCriteria:
User cannot attempt password reset more than 3 times per hour.
System logs an attempt each time a user requests a password reset.
User receives a notification when the rate limit is reached.

Summary: Audit Event for Successful Password Reset
Description: Send an audit event to the system logs when a password is successfully reset.
AcceptanceCriteria:
Audit event is generated upon successful password reset.
Audit event includes user ID and timestamp.
Audit event is accessible in system logs.

Summary: Regression Testing for Existing Login Flow
Description: Conduct regression tests to ensure the existing login flow is not affected by the new password reset feature.
AcceptanceCriteria:
Existing login functionality remains unchanged.
No new errors are introduced in the login process.
All existing login test cases pass successfully.
